website_summaries.verdict: Ideal for those who are constantly having to put on and take off cleats, and don't want to spend a lot of time doing it.
pros: Thermoplastic elastomers add flexibility and durability
Very easy to put on and remove
Once off, you have a carrying bag to keep them in
cons: These run a little small, so you should probably order up a size
Not as comfortable as other models

customer_reviews.title: BROKE Almost Immediately!
customer_reviews.text: Update: After wearing these less than 10 times outside, one of the rubber straps SNAPPED OFF AT THE SEAM while putting them back on a pair of boots. Not happy about that. Review changed from 5-stars to 1-star. -- Otherwise: Best ice-cleats I've ever used. Have been using them for off-trail hiking in snow that's turned to ice. The spikes do a great job of digging in, especially going up and down hills. Great for late winter when everything is melting and refreezing.
customer_reviews.author: RobotsInVermont

customer_reviews.title: They Work Well
customer_reviews.text: I purchase these to fit over a pair of insulated boots, oversized to accommodate their insulation. We had some freezing rain on top of already frozen ice ending up with about 1/2" of hard uneven ice. I tried these on relatively flat and steeply inclined surfaces and they were fantastic. Sizing is important so there is no slack chain between heal and toe. Thus fitted they provide very confident footing.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Durable, great for hiking and trail running
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a cheaper alternative to the typical hillsound or Kahtoola microspikes I’ve been buying and using for the past 6 years. I’m surprised with how well these less expensive microspikes have performed! They’ve got the right amount of traction and have been holding up really well. I’ve used them hiking the NH white mountains and on smaller trail runs. I’ve even used them on road runs when the roads were covered in ice and snow. I’ll be sticking with these microspikes from now on to save some money!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: They broke on the first use
customer_reviews.text: The plastic part of the cleats must be of very poor quality since it failed the first time I went hiking with them. I got the cleats to wear on a slippery/muddy ridge trail and after about 1.5 miles of hiking, the plastic part failed and tore. This made the cleats completely unusable. It also made the rest of my ridge hike considerably more dangerous. To add to my dissatisfaction, the zipper on the little case broke off as well. This is not the kind of equipment you want to have failing on you as it could literally end up being the difference between life and death depending on where you are.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: They break after 10 uses
customer_reviews.text: Ive tried a number of these crampon type things. I need them where I live in northern Maine. I don't beat them up that badly - I use them on snow and ice covered dirt roads. They just don't last. No one sells 'kits' to fix them either. The metal just breaks. I'm trying a different style now. I wouldn't get any of the ones like this that are stretch on shoe bottoms unless you use them rarely.
customer_reviews.author: joyce blackall

customer_reviews.title: This is the 3rd buy that the sizes don't fit the BOOTS
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why so many manufacturers/importers/distributors don't actually use and see for themselves what their products are like. For instance the perforated lines on a lot of paper forms don't work as expected. In terms of the Unigear Traction Cleats size XL, it is exactly the same measurements as my existing size X Kahtoola Microspikes which I have to use pliers to help putting on my size 11 boots. The size chart does not have an exclusive guidance JUST FOR THE BOOTS.The size chart just give you shoe size ....should buy size XL. And size XL is the largest I can buy? Come on! And Size X brand A and Size XL brand B are exactly the same?
customer_reviews.author: Atu

customer_reviews.title: expectations not me but fixed
customer_reviews.text: I had high expectations that these cleats xlarge would fit on my size 11 shoe, but after trying for 45 minutes gave up will be returning, vendor reached out with a video. the problem was ME-User error, finally figured out how to put on my shoe! Here in the Chicago area, we have had some serious ice. a few weeks back I fell on the black ice and went to ER-luckily, no problems. that forced me to get the crampons. Glad I have them and the vendor was so helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Winter hiking necessities
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for winter hiking in the Rockies. Being on a budget the price and quality is just what I needed. I’ve used once so far this season and this product worked beautifully. Right after our first big snow of the season last week, I hit the trail. Trail conditions was super icy. First thing at the trailhead I slipped and fell on ice. I then put these spikes on and started on an 8 mile trek with no further slips. I wore them for the entire trek over steep and rocky terrain and sections where snow was melting also. The spikes did not bend or break. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley slawson

customer_reviews.title: Beefy, heavy duty but light weight.
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome! The cleats are larger than the ones I had before but if you put a little down pressure on them when you step like step a little harder than normal you can feel them dig in. Living in the Adirondacks one day it could be in the single digits next in the 40s followed by singles again which leaves a nice slick sheet of ice and these are great for walking around with, easy on, easy off and so much traction. I've personally fallen while walking across the driveway and thought I had damaged my tailbone not again. The price on these were a nice bonus too. My last pair cost me in the $60 range.
customer_reviews.author: J. amell

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 10 minutes of walking
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my wife for hiking on icy and or packed snow trails. 10 minutes after getting started on hard pack snow the link to the spikes broke rendering them useless. Cheap!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great traction
customer_reviews.text: For how much I like these, I wanted to give them 5 stars. However, the first pair I got broke after the first use and I had to exchange them. One of the chains ripped through the rubber mounting hole. I cannot figure out why because there was little stress on that hole (or any other) while in use. I wish some company would insert mold metal rings inside the holes in the rubber where the chains are attached. That being said, these perform well, provide great traction, and are easy to put on and stay in place well.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen W. LaHote

customer_reviews.title: THANK YOU FOR THIS PRODUCT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Well-made. Great traction. The design should make these much sturdier than the other brands I've tried because the rubber part goes over the top of the boots, as opposed to on the soles of the boots. The rubber parts always break easily on the other brands. These are metal on the bottom with the rubber to hold them on on top. They also have a strap for securing them on my boots in deep snow. The seller shipped them promptly so that I got them in time for the big storm this past weekend. Great packaging with handy storage pouch I can hang with my dogs' leashes.
customer_reviews.author: E. OBD

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product!
customer_reviews.text: I received these the other day and I am very pleased with them. I have large feet (men's size 15) and there wasn't much around in the way of crampons. These are the answer to my prayers! The only other product I could find was $60 and it was the exact same thing as this. This product is sturdy, yet stretches out well. I have walked around on them a couple of times and they haven't loosened so I am extremely happy. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Lester

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hiking in all conditions
customer_reviews.text: I've hiked with these several times now on a variety of conditions (packed snow, ice, etc) in the US and in the Alps and find them very helpful for maintaining traction. I chose these for the velcro strap to help keep them in place and for the carrying bag which so far has protected my other gear from the spikes. With good balance I'm able to put them on without having to sit down. Would recommend this product if you are looking for something similar.
customer_reviews.author: JVarn74

customer_reviews.title: Great cleats for ice fishing
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for ice fishing. They work fantastic. I got the XL and they fit my big size 14 snow boots well. There’s a lot of stretch in the rubber. The cleats themselves seem very sturdy. I’ve used them several times on the ice and are great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. Loftis

customer_reviews.title: Serious ice cleats!!!
customer_reviews.text: Beware of walking on floors, they have large sharp points that will scratch or damage most fished floors. They do come off fairly easily. Going back on takes a short minute. These are great for us with a large rural yard and long driveway that was very icy this year. You WILL NOT slip with these! I also like how they strap on so they won't come off on you during a walk– doesn't take much snow to not be able to find an ice cleat that's come off on you... ask me how I know. Glad I bought these!
customer_reviews.author: GreatNorthWoods

customer_reviews.title: Mischief Managed
customer_reviews.text: Got these for mud-season and winter running/hiking. Turns out they are a bit aggressive for running (like wearing 5# weights) but managed just fine on an icy run on a hilly gravel road. My confidence level soared as far as traction was concerned, which was precisely the point of this purchase - to have the right gear to get outside more this winter doing the things I love. The adjustable velcro strap was an enviable feature by my running companions; I like that there is a carrying bag so I can stow these in my car for whenever the occasion calls for them. Go get 'em!
customer_reviews.author: BoilerShoeholic

customer_reviews.title: Buy ‘em - you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.text: These things are FABULOUS! Bought them specifically because the driveway was a sheet of ice and shoveling was hazardous. My coil YakTrax were not up to the task. In these I felt invincible! Took them hiking on the north shore of Lake Superior on the ice on the shore. Worked great there too. My partner bought a pair to keep in the car. Well worth the money. My shoe size was on the border between 2 sizes so I went with the larger size. Easy to put on and still stayed put with no problem. Buy ‘em!
customer_reviews.author: Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Did the job for the brief period I needed them.
customer_reviews.text: These got the job done for me and my friend when we backpacked into the grand canyon. You need these for the rim during the winter because of the ice. We were skeptical because we didn't want to fully cheap out on something that could keep us from slipping off the side of the canyon lol but we also didn't want to spend 3-4x the money for something thatd we only once a year. For us, these didn't break and did the job. You also gotta be smart about how you use these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Cleats!  They do the job!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, these cleats really work. Our driveway this year, which is a gravel driveway, is completely covered in ice. These cleats make you not have to worry about anything, just walk. They really do bite into the ice!!! I would have given them 5 stars except there was no instruction manual on how to put them on. The back is the cleats is labeled, but there is a wire that keeps the front chains for on separating, which I now understand goes over the toes. But if they had a quick instruction guide, they would be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: C. Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and function
customer_reviews.text: These fit well, are stable to walk on and stay firmly on boots. I emailed the seller to determine if there is a right and or left, and got an immediate response (there isnt). I used these for hiking and running a snow blower on basic hiking boots, and winter boots in ice and heavy snow and they work great. I gave them a four instead of a five as the metal bottoms are pretty high profile, so can feel wonky if you use them in slippery conditions with just ice, or less than a few inches of snow.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Great When Intact But 2/3 Failed
customer_reviews.text: When these are working and on my feet they work wonderfully - can really carve into ice and hard packed snow in the White Mountains of NH. We got 3 pairs - however 2 failed in the first couple hikes - chain links broke and had to improvise on the trail. I will still use them on day hikes but I would buy a different brand if I was going to do any winter multi-day.
customer_reviews.author: theKbru

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the winter after going through too many pairs of cheapo yaktrax. I have worn these in the woods for many days each week, and they work great. I have a women's size 9.5 and bought the large so they would fit easily on hiking boots and snowboots. They are easy to get on and off. And they are priced right!
customer_reviews.author: Riverbox45

customer_reviews.title: These Work Beautifully!!
customer_reviews.text: These "traction cleats Ice Snow Grips" worked beautifully--over my hiking boots--all around my house and ranch that was covered with very treacherous, hard ice this last winter. They are not climbinh-grade crampons, but they are very substantial and stable, and they appear to be fairly well made--so that they should be good for a few more years. The weakest aspect is the rubber-like ring that holds the chain ends up around the boot; durability of this piece remains to be seen. For the money, these are a definite bargain!!
customer_reviews.author: A. K. Posluszny

customer_reviews.title: These hit the sweet spot for price and quality.
customer_reviews.text: Have not used these yet but they seem durable and well constructed. Sizing was confusing for boots or athletic shoes. I went with the XL for size 12 and they fit both the shoes and the boots.. Shopped a bit for these. Some are cheaper and they break easily. Others are quite a bit more expensive. Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Bershak

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my yak-traks tended to fall off my boots when I walked down my driveway clearing snow and because I wasn't sure the yak-traks had enough grip on ice. The advantages of these are that they stay on, even negotiating steep hills and they have excellent grip. I feel safe even on ice on a fairly steep incline. I've not had any slipping in them. The disadvantage compared to yak-trax and similar thinner products is that they are a little harder to get on and off and you can't walk in them, at all, on any indoor floor that may get scratched.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Butler Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Safety first
customer_reviews.text: This Michigan weather of the last few weeks was crazy. After falling on my butt as well as on my face, I decided to just give in and buy these. And wow, what a difference. I am now turning out my horses and doing farm chores without being afraid of hitting the ground again :-)
customer_reviews.author: caroline

customer_reviews.title: Good build quality for the price, excellent fulfillment speed and communication
customer_reviews.text: I wear a US Men's size 9 and these in M fit perfectly on my shoes. My hiking boots they are a bit of a stretch and a L might be a better fit for the bulkier build. Overall they are exactly what I expected and worked like a charm on the treacherous February ice!
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Zlomke

customer_reviews.title: Great stability
customer_reviews.text: These cleats are probably overkill for what I need them for, but they've done a fantastic job for me. I have a bit of a balance problem and have previously broken my leg by slipping on ice, so I wanted something heavy duty just to walk on sidewalks, parking lots, etc. This works so well. I feel very stable walking with these on. They are also quite easy to get on my boots and stay put when they are on.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Stands up to the challenges and needs of public safety
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be more pleased with this product. Stands up to the challenges and needs of public safety in harsh winter environments. I purchased these to use during a recent winter storm in the Cleveland, OH area and they worked incredibly! They fit well and stayed on my boots the entire shift. They were even comfortable to drive with. I was able to transition from car, to pavement or concrete, to ground without ever slipping. Walking or running wasn't an issue either. I recommend these to anyone, especially anyone in public safety. They're made very well and won't disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Every Expectation
customer_reviews.text: Cleats arrived yesterday, just in time for a trial on the thick glaze of ice left after some heavy rain, melting snow and a drop in temperature. They could not have performed any better, providing positive traction. I especially like that the binding system seems especially bulletproof- the velcro-fastened strap across the top provides an extra measure of confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Catskill Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great microspikes for the price point!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of Unigear I have purchased, the second pair being a gift. I’ve had my personal pair for over a year and they are holding up well. Excellent traction and ease putting them on. I also liked the color choices. I highly recommend these microspikes for the price point!
customer_reviews.author: DPH

customer_reviews.title: It is great.
customer_reviews.text: I walk my dog on a mountain trail by my home. Lots of snow and Ice and a frozen creek I cross twice. I have them strapped to Kamik boots so my feet stay warm. I had used another traction cleat but this one is better made and cheaper. Go for it, you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: David Bingham

customer_reviews.title: Total life and hike savers
customer_reviews.text: These SAVED us in Sedona when there was a freak snow storm. We had planned two hikes there and another big one at the Grand Canyon. There is no way we could have done it without these. Everyone around us without them was slipping and scrambling and we just marched on. Great quality. A bit heavy, but that is expected and not a deterrent for us. Would definitely purchase again and highly recommend to anyone thinking of hiking or walking in the snow/ice.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: I’d recommend these!
customer_reviews.text: I wore them today for the first time on a path that was shear ice after a day of freezing rain followed by sub-freezing temperatures. I never slipped once - the spikes dug into the ice beautifully. No one else was on the path because of the ice, but I moved along confidently for four miles. The grips slipped over my Merrill hiking shoes easily - and came off just as easily. I didn’t use the Velcro straps because I couldn’t figure out how to apply them - and as it turned out, I didn’t need them. I think their only function is to display the product name. I would recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Salvatore A. DiPillo

customer_reviews.title: Great traction cleats
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely what I needed. I have a slope behind my back fence that is always so hard to weed and I’m always slipping. These were perfect and I wasn’t afraid of falling. They look really durable and I wear a size 9 women’s running shoe and they fit perfect! I just couldn’t figure out the extra strap that was included to secure them over the front of the shoe. I’ll take another look at it and see what I’m doing wrong. Otherwise they were great!
customer_reviews.author: william e. noll

customer_reviews.title: Broke during first time using.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these based on good reviews. I took them on a backpacking excursion where I knew I'd need them. The rubber tore near the toe on the first day of use and the chain broke in multiple spots. I managed to adjust the Velcro strap to keep them secured onto my foot for the remainder of the trip, but that was the extent of use for them. I will not be buying this brand of spikes again and cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best ice cleats we've ever owned and we've had several. My husband and I both love ours and we're living with light snow over solid slippery ice at the moment. Easy to put on, solid feel covering the entire bottom of boot, sharp spikes (not rolled wires that get caught on everything like - Yak Trax). 10 star rating here.
customer_reviews.author: janel

customer_reviews.title: Great for icy hiking
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty darn good for the money. The chain and spikes are of higher quality than others that appear similar. This is my first pair of micro spikes and I live the traction the provide. I've used them several times on hikes in Maine this winter and they made a huge difference. I couldn't have gotten up (or) down many spots without them. They require occasional repositioning but generally pretty stable. They seem ambidextrous but mine came appearing to both be labeled as left. I can't notice so much while using them so I didn't contact company. Overall a good purchase. Oh, the storage/travel container included is great.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Porter

customer_reviews.title: Great Performance
customer_reviews.text: I have been on about 8 hikes since the purchase of product. Great results so far on muddy trails packed snow slushy and hard packed ice. I walked a little gingerly on a steep icy trail not knowing if the spikes were really going to hold me. No problem! I've even broken some trail of 4 to 6 inches of snow after a storm-they have held in every type of footing condition. Very Impressed!!
customer_reviews.author: joe b.

customer_reviews.title: These are great
customer_reviews.text: I broke my leg and ankle last year due to snow and ice. These give me confidence and traction on slippery snowy or heavily packed snow streets by my home. 100% satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These cleats are very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: My package of cleats right on time. My first impression was that they looked beautiful. They were easy to put on, and now I am looking forward to using them this year on our winter weather. Last year we had much ice and it was not easy to walk. I had another pair of cleats but they just wore out. So far I am happy that I ordered these cleats, I believe I will be happy to use these and my walking will be safe with these cleats.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Great traction on ice, snow and mud.
customer_reviews.text: Just returned from hike down and back to Phantom Ranch at Colorado river in Grand Canyon. Used the Unigear Traction cleats for first time and extremely impressed with them and made a big difference in my comfort, stability and safety on snow, ice and mud I encountered on trail. Easy to put on over hiking boots even while on trail. Traction cleats felt very secure and did not move or shift or need adjustment once on my boots. Also liked strap across top of boot which kept cleats snuggly attached to boots. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Non-skid happiness
customer_reviews.text: Great traction devices. We live near a ski resort and I keep a set for our visiting guests. Keeps our guests upright and from sliding down an incline or stairway. Easy to put on, take off and has a great size accommodation for various users.
customer_reviews.author: carole christianson

customer_reviews.title: A must!
customer_reviews.text: Came with a case (they were inside of them). I’m a size 10.5 and they fit perfectly! I can’t even describe how nice it is to finally get traction on ice! I used em for ice fishing, walking the dogs, and hiking and I’ll buy more if they ever break!
customer_reviews.author: C. Jansen

customer_reviews.title: If you buy purchase a second set as spares.
customer_reviews.text: Took these out today to climb Quandary Peak. The black strap snapped in the parking lot. Weather was -1 and we had driven two hours so this was a bummer. Then after 1 hour of hiking the metal.ring bent and snapped on the left one. I bought the correct size. Super bummed.
customer_reviews.author: JWild

customer_reviews.title: Amazing grip on snow and ice
customer_reviews.text: We have had a tough four weeks or so here in Minnesota. What feels like ongoing snowstorms and three days of a polar vortex at 28 below zero. I couldn't get down my driveway to get my mail without slipping constantly. Decided I had to get spikes, and these totally solved my problem. No hint of slipping; each step seems to get a firm grip. Highly recommended. I bought the extra-large which fit my size 12 double wide shoes.
customer_reviews.author: BEB

customer_reviews.title: Well fitting and easy on/off
customer_reviews.text: I have had previously spikes, and these are the best. Fit is excellent, and the strap over the foot is an extra bonus. Bought two pairs, and each an exact fit. We live in the country (read good luck on getting roads feee of ice) and they enable us to walk the block to our mail box with out flopping to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Norma

customer_reviews.title: Beast.
customer_reviews.text: These cleats are beast. If you slip or fall while wearing them, it’s the beer’s fault. These are bear claws.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Great on flat terrain, dangerous on mountain hikes.
customer_reviews.text: They're great if you're using them while I've fishing, or taking a walk along flat terrain. Spikes really dig into the ice. They do not however stand up to a mountainous hike. My first winter mountain hike one of the eyelets had broken causing the chain to separate from the rubber strap. This made the downhill return trip very precarious. Nearly slipped a few times on my way down. The hike down would have been much easier, and safer, if these had not broken. 3 stars though as they are great on flat terrain or frozen lakes, so if that's your intended use, buy them. If you're hiking in the mountains, get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Storage bag they come in could be better
customer_reviews.text: Have used these for a few snowy hikes and they have been great! We store them in the small canvas bag they come in - the bag itself is really stiff, so closing the tie on the bag is annoying because it never closes all the way. But the spikes themselves have been really reassuring for winter hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No slipping
customer_reviews.text: I felt so safe wearing these all winter. Our driveway and the surrounding area was practically a skating rink for several weeks. I walked the dog daily with these over my snow boots and didn’t slip once on the ice. I wear 8.5-9 and followed the size guide; I bought a large. They fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: S. May

customer_reviews.title: If you’re getting too soft... these are the cure
customer_reviews.text: If you’re middle aged, and you like feeling invincible in the woods as you navigate rugged terrain; running, walking, panting (as though a fearsome predator was chasing you, but hopefully not too much, because you need to stop every couple minutes to catch your breath or to get distracted by a cool rock) then these are for you. You’ve spent enough of your life indoors. Strap these suckers on your feet, and cruise down a nearly vertical slope like you’re a snow leopard, and get back home before the kids go to bed, because it’s probably your turn to do the dishes. Not recommended for bowling.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sandberg

customer_reviews.title: Great Traction on Ice
customer_reviews.text: Got these for the wife. We live in Upstate New York and have really bad winters here. It's been very icy this year and these have been a tremendous help for her to not slip slide away.
customer_reviews.author: Russ S

customer_reviews.title: Good traction for the money
customer_reviews.text: Tried them out over the weekend while exploring a frozen waterfall in Wisconsin. Never slipped or felt unsafe. Kind of felt invincible. I question longevity (particularly the Velcro strap) if you use them daily but for the casual user I'd recommend them. My only nitpick would be the size of the storage case could be a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: William Toepke

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Five stars after one use - fingers crossed they hold up! Using for weedeating on crazy steep hills. Have worn sturdy hiking/work boots before but have to dig in to keep my footing. After one use, I'm wishing I had tried these sooner. My footing was so much better/ with traction with the spikes.
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Great! Second pair purchased
customer_reviews.text: I use these ice cleats to walk my dog in the woods in winter and have used them as well in my yard when it is iced over. This is the second pair I bought, for when friends / family come on walks with me. As expected others also had trouble participating in the dog walks and keeping up with me and my dog without falling, and now they can keep up and keep safe. Dogs have claws that help them walk on ice. These allow me to keep up with my dog without falling.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Gave 4stars but could be 5stars!
customer_reviews.text: Only gave a 4star rating because he has only used them once. But they seem to be very well made and really secure your footing on the ice and snow. I ordered a large as he is a size 8 shoe, and they fit nicely over his hiking shoes and his boots. If they continue to perform well and last well, they will definitely be a 5star.
customer_reviews.author: phat

customer_reviews.title: Super Grip!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Tried these on a very icy and hard packed snow trail for 2 miles up a frozen stream bed, with some climbing around boulders and such. These spikes never slipped on my boots, and provided a very good no slip grip on a very slick and tricky hike. Easy to put on and take off. Quite secure on boot. Lightweight, stainless steel chain and cleats, no rust, well designed and made. Highly recommend! Great follow up email from retailer, shows genuine concern for his product and your satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Tops in safety!
customer_reviews.text: These cleats are perfect! Not one slip! Unigear Traction cleats for gripping in ice and snow are very well made and they are essential safety gear if you live in an area that gets a rough winter. There are a lot of products that are similar, and I've never owned grips/spikes/cleats before, but I picked these because they have the most cleats, 18. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Max A. Brinck

customer_reviews.title: Runs true to size
customer_reviews.text: I bought the unigear spikes for hiking in the winter. Took them out for a short hike in the packed snow and ice, and immediately noticed a difference in traction. Felt very confident with every step. My only issues were with them staying in place. I found that my left side kept shifting towards the outside of my boot, but that could be do to my stride. My only other observation is in the upper harness. I wish it came in a nylon strapping instead of rubber. Overall, I'm pleased with them and should workout until I can upgrade to a more durable pair.
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great traction cleats!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of traction cleats. I got the X Large size since my hiking shoes are Merril size 12. They fit perfectly and were not difficult to put on. The Velcro strap keeps them secure. I was pleasantly surprised by how easy it was to hike with these on. My first hike was over 2 hours long and my feet felt steady and secure the entire time. I was hiking on ice, snow and gravel with moderate elevation changes. The cleats are sturdy yet light and can easily fit in my backpack so I can have them when I need them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for ice conditions
customer_reviews.text: We hike the Ice Age Trail every month. The trail can be very slick especially if it freezes again after a warm day. The cleats give me awesome traction and comfort. Wiffie and I are both past halfway on the 1100 mile trail. We can't let a slippery track stop us. You may be the only hikers out there!
customer_reviews.author: Ed Abell, author of 'My Father's Keep'

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my 83yro dad so he doesn't have to worry about falling. They've been a Godsend. I can't recommend them enough. Get a pair and keep them on a pair of shoes, no more worrying about losing your footing.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Neis

customer_reviews.title: Chain links break easily
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these at first, but after a few trips, one of the chain links broke. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: krista

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on and they stay on
customer_reviews.text: I work for Vail ski resorts and I’m on all types of surfaces from black ice to heavy snow. I’ve tried many different brands but this is by far the best value for what you get. Easy to put on and they stay on.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I have searched for a long time for sturdy cleats and have tried a few others that were horrible and never stayed on my feet. These are perfect! They stay on great and are sturdy and have not dented or damaged the spikes at all. I'm very happy with this purchase and would highly recommend this brand
customer_reviews.author: Suzanna

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good!
customer_reviews.text: I've worn the Unigear cleats on several snow hikes and around the yard and they are holding up well, fit well and stay on the boots. They work great on compact snow and ice. These are a great lower-cost alternative to more expensive brands and work just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jon R. Herman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for snow over ice on roads
customer_reviews.text: Was not looking forward to walking the dog on our snow-covered streets in the mountains of southern Colorado. I have found them to be pretty treacherous because a thin layer of snow often covers very slick patches of ice that are pretty dangerous when walking in regular hiking boots. These cleats have completely solved the problem. I actually look forward to going out to walk on our snow-packed and icy roads!
customer_reviews.author: Roadrider

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind on snow and ice.
customer_reviews.text: These are doing the trick for me to walk my dogs! My husband had to stretch them over my snow boots because they were tight and I have poor hand strength. I think I would be able to stretch them over my hikers ok. I have to remind myself to pick up my feet. No more shuffling in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Cleats
customer_reviews.text: This was a request from my granddaughter that lives in Breckenridge. She lives at 10,300' and they get a LOT of snow. The family goes for walks and they live on a very steep hill. She is a very thorough person and always does her research and these are the ones she wanted. She will be getting them for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Denise in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Look and feels very durable
customer_reviews.text: These look high-quality and durable, I have not used them outside yet but I hopefully will within the next couple of days. I got these because the coiled yak tracks are absolute garbage and broke on me when I was doing an 18-mile winter ruck. Why decided to invest in a good pare, the only complaint I have about these is that they are quite large for my boot. They will stay on but not as tight as I'd like; I'm afraid that they will shift and or might fall off during a movement. I wish there was a medium pair I could get, otherwise, this is an affordable and durable product.
customer_reviews.author: College Kid

customer_reviews.title: Each piece of equipment has a purpose and these fulfilled their promise.
customer_reviews.text: They went on easy and worked well, the 1/2 teeth helped more so than other brands due to the fact these teeth are a 1/2" however the top layer of ice had melted and the cleats still worked well. This particular write up for our group should have noted Clampon's with 1-1/2 teeth and Snowshoes. So I'm very please and I'll most likely by these again when they are worn out. But I'll also buy the snowshoes and large tooth clampon's too.
customer_reviews.author: David Plamondon

customer_reviews.title: These do their job!
customer_reviews.text: I love these, I have a fear of falling on ice and these make me feel safe. I was even able to visit the Eben ice caves with these. They go on easily and the strap keeps them in place,
customer_reviews.author: Julia S

customer_reviews.title: Smart product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve hiked in ice with and without these, and let me tell you they are a life saver. They are very sturdy! I get pulled around on the ice by 2 dogs and they are keeping fine.
customer_reviews.author: VeronicaQ

customer_reviews.title: 1st use
customer_reviews.text: Worked well on 1st use. Working on ski jumping hills - quite steep and can be quite icy and they bite in really well. Seems like a good product - hopefully will hold up and provide years of service.
customer_reviews.author: Kayaker19

customer_reviews.title: Great traction for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time wearing crampons, and wow!! They are a must have for hiking in icy areas. You feel like spider man with the amount of traction on ice they give. We were able to do a difficult hike that others without micro-spikes were sliding down and having to turn back on. They were easy to put on and figure out, and held up well during a hike that had some rocks etc. Highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Christy Reuter

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have shoveled paths around my hilly yard that ice over in winter from rain, melt etc. they are sheer and dangerous. These UNIGEAR Tracrion cleats have good size cleats that really dig in. No slips. Easy to put on and take off. They are secure and stay in place. I use them cutting firewood and they stay in place even while working in brush and deep snow.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Stigler

customer_reviews.title: Great value, durable
customer_reviews.text: I hike once per week in the mountains of northern Utah. Lots of snow and ice. These snow spikes have never met me down, even on areas of solid ice. Great price, too.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy R. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for thick ice.  Not ideal for thin ice, city streets, etc.
customer_reviews.text: These are badass. On thick ice, the spikes don’t budge at all! They bite into the ground and stay planted until you lift your foot. Totally recommend these for anyone walking around on surfaces with ice/snow more than about .5” thick so the spikes have something to dig into. The spikes are almost too long to wear on a road with just a thin coating of ice. They aren’t very comfortable unless you are on a surface that they can sink into; otherwise you end up sort of hobbling and clanking down the road.
customer_reviews.author: BigBlueTruck

customer_reviews.title: Great product, nice customer support!
customer_reviews.text: I hiked on these one day and LOVED them. While people without crampons or microspikes were sliding all over, I felt totally stable. Unfortunately, when I took them off I saw that one of the connectors had gotten lost, so they weren't wearable. Fortunately, customer service responded quickly and was helpful. They sent a replacement pair quickly and I was ready for more hikes.
customer_reviews.author: guppygirl

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: Within the first 30 min of putting them on & walking into town one of the connecting wires between cleats broke & I still had to get back home while having a sloppy fit. Returned & received another set with same thing happening again but was still home & could fix it. The connecting wires should have ends closed better & weilded because they will detach from cleat very easily otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Mathews

customer_reviews.title: Love these!!
customer_reviews.text: We got these a couple weeks back and have fallen in love with them. Our typical snow hikes in the Seattle area are usually on well worn paths. Snow shoes are not needed but traction is. We see people tromping around the trails on flat snow in snowshoes and we walk right past them with these. Super light weight. Incredibly easy to get on. Worth it at twice the price. LOVE THEM!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Living in the Midwest, I have to deal with snow and ice in the winter. I feel confident walking outside even in the worst weather with these spikes on my winter boots. Also, I like how they come with a nice little bag.
customer_reviews.author: Anna O.

customer_reviews.title: Effective!
customer_reviews.text: Effective for walking on hiking slopes with slippery packed snow and on icy concrete stairs in the parks. I wore them only once and didn't get around to putting on the straps. I'm hoping a strap will tighten up the chains. They "dangled" a bit when my foot was lifted. Durability is TBD after I use them a while. Overall, happy with the purchase and price.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on and remove. Great for packed snow and ice!
customer_reviews.text: These make all the difference waling on icy and snow-packed sidewalks and trails. My husband walks a lot in the winter, and we live in an area that gets lots of snow. These allow him to walk without fear of slipping in icy conditions. They go on and off fairly easy, but you do need to sit to put them on. And don't wear them in the house!
customer_reviews.author: Janet D

customer_reviews.title: Ice Won't Knock You off Your Feet!
customer_reviews.text: These are GREAT! Easy on/off. Work on black ice, thick ice, under snow ice. Living in Saint Paul, MN requires ice/snow conquering gear. These "crampons" do the trick. I'm 75--have fallen numerous times with injuries. Not any more.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Ivi

customer_reviews.title: Polar vortex fighter
customer_reviews.text: Received these a day early and really needed them. Crazy weather went from 45° to 3° (with windchills in the -40s) in a matter of days which turned everything into solid ice. No more slip sliding down my driveway now, though. Love these!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Just buy these - I love them!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough great things about these ice cleats. I walk a 110 pound dog on Michigan ice covered sidewalks and these changes my life! They grip 100% and I feel so safe walking now. Someone should have told me sooner about these! I can’t wait to ice hike with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well for hiking
customer_reviews.text: We have two pairs, one M for size 7.5 boots and one XL for size 10.5 boots, both fit fine. Used them on a 9 mile mountain hike through packed snow, a bit of ice, and some exposed boulders. So far so good, no damage or rust, and they worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for occasional use
customer_reviews.text: The added strap was not as high quality as the main product. Some of the linkages to the spikes are a bit clumsy but that’s just because I humbled them up instead of storing them neatly and gently. The product seems durable, no signs of wear after 8 miles of hiking on hilly, snowy terrain.
customer_reviews.author: ferrarifan33

customer_reviews.title: Great performance for running
customer_reviews.text: I use these for running in Bozeman, Mt. Snow & or ice have been on the ground since November. These spikes are great for traction, even downhill on an icy hill. The reason for the 3 star rating is one of the chains broke on the bottom of my shoe after 8 days of use. Very disappointing. I can still use them but do not have the complete confidence in their performance.
customer_reviews.author: Eveline D.

customer_reviews.title: Quality spikes...
customer_reviews.text: I live in the Catskills where ice and hard packed snow can be a real hazard. I always have a pair of spikes or cleats to start every winter season, and they are not all equal! In the 15 years that I have been purchasing cleats for ice, these are by FAR the best and smartest cleats on the market. They will last because of the quality and design that far outshines any of the competition. If you'e ever fallen on the ice, then you know just how dangerous it can be. You won't be disappointed with this purchase, and they just may save your life!
customer_reviews.author: cosmos

customer_reviews.title: Very good for walking dogs in snow!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Great product! I regularly walk two strong Labradors, and these crampons enabled me to walk them today in compact snow and ice without worrying that I would slip and fall. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Candy Freeling

customer_reviews.title: A little heavier but quality
customer_reviews.text: A little heavier than I expected but still light for the quality ( which I'm gonna be thankful for when it counts ). I like the velcro adjustment on the top and the rest is also of high quality. Going to be taking this on my through hike of the Appalachian trail
customer_reviews.author: Jesse A.

customer_reviews.title: Great price but keep the warranty card!
customer_reviews.text: I really want to give this product 4-5 stars but the only reason I can't is because one of the chains broke with in my first mile hiking in the Catskills using these. My bf's held up great! Dealing with the broken chain was a pain but overall they performed well giving me the grip I needed hiking in the snow and ice. There was a warranty card that came with the product and as soon as I find it I hope to use it LOL. That being said, I would still buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Infante

customer_reviews.title: Ease of application
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to use my traction cleats yet but I did try them on. They were very easy to put on over my big clunky boots and jut as easy to remove. I know I will get a lot of use out of these. I have 2 prosthetic hips and a prosthetic knee so I have a big fear of falling, not with these babies though.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Anne Alexandet

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for hiking Estes Park
customer_reviews.text: We are Floridians so my husband and I won’t get a ton of use out of these, but we went on vacation to Colorado and did some hiking in Estes Park in April. They were an absolute necessity and I’m so glad we bought them. For the price, we thought it was worth it just to buy some spikes instead of renting. We will save them for our next snowy adventure!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very well made!
customer_reviews.text: These are great for Michigan winters and for intermediate to difficult hikes! I’m a size 11.5 and the XL fit great! I really like the strap that tightens over the top. They fit over my work boots and my hiking boots. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Badger

customer_reviews.title: Work great...great traction...easy on off
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for hiking on icy trails near Steamboat Colo. Taken them places normally reserved for snowshoes. On packed icy surfaces these things rock. They are also easy to put on and take off and stay in place. Gold star. Better than the more expensive options I've used.
customer_reviews.author: tom snitzer

product_meta.title: Unigear Traction Cleats Ice Snow Grips with 18 Spikes for Walking, Jogging, Climbing and Hiking
feature_bullets: Lighter and tougher, it helps to deliver unrivaled traction on icy winter trails. The main body of elastomer band is comprised of stretchy Thermoplastic Elastomer (TPE) which is of flexibility, anti-abrasion as well as anti-tearing and could improve longevity for a quick and secure fit on a variety of footwear.
The heavy duty crampons are best in class, with long-lasting soles which are equipped with heat-treated stainless steel cleats that bite into the slickest ice and snow.

Balance Enhanced - feature 18 spikes per foot, with 12 spikes at the forefoot and 6 spikes at the heel. Each wide heel plate with 3 spikes is for secure downhill traction and each spike is 1/2” long. The spikes are made from heat-treated stainless steel for excellent durability and corrosion resistance.

Full-sole coverage with cleats on heel and forefoot is to maintain traction through your natural stride and pursuing your passion for the outdoors. Easy to put on and take off with secure and adjustable straps.
60 Days 100% Satisfaction: If you are not 100% satisfied with this product for any reason, please contact customer service within 60 days, and we will immediately help you to solve the problem.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
